posts.cooked:
Hey,

I am trying to send values/information over a pi to the roborio using network tables, specifically SmartDashBoard. I plugged in the pi via ethernet to the radio, plugged it into power using the roborio. However, I cannot put any values to SmartDashboard. Currently, I upload my Python file to the WPILib rPi imager (wpilibpi.local) and there has been no errors in the output. Here is a short snippet that has the relevant code:

Could anyone help resolve this issue? Any help is greatly appreciated!

posts.name: Peter Johnson
posts.cooked:
If that’s the entirety of the NT-related code, I see a few things missing.

You need to start the NT client (nt.startClient()) with your team number.  This will connect NT to the Rio NT server.

Putting numbers should be in some kind of loop–all the NT calls are non-blocking.  If you just set a couple of numbers and exit, NT won’t have time to connect.  In addition, even if it did have time to connect, disconnecting will result in removing the values from the NT server (unless specific options are set).

Sorry, I do have the portion where I put the numbers to the network tables in a while loop. Assuming that’s correct, all I would need to add is nt.startClient(4829) ? Would I have to do any of the code below?

posts.name: Peter Johnson
posts.cooked: You should do the first two lines (startClient4 and setServerTeam).
What do I put inside the start client? THe IP address, the team number?

posts.name: Peter Johnson
posts.cooked:
startClient4() takes an “identity” string, so it can simply be something like “coprocessor”.

setServerTeam() takes your team number.
Thanks so much! It works now

posts.name: system

data.title: Sending Values Over Network Tables using a raspberry Pi

accepted_answer.excerpt:
startClient4() takes an “identity” string, so it can simply be something like “coprocessor”. 
setServerTeam() takes your team number.
